TopicTitle: Kerbal Stuff, an open-source Space Port replacement

Articles.Content:
I posted this on Reddit:

Hello! First of all, everything is back to normal now. The problem turned out to be a weird disk space problem and has since been resolved. Unfortunately, it occured shortly after Majiir and I had a (minor) argument and a lot of circumstances combined led me to rashly wonder if it was intentional. Of course, it wasn't, and it was stupid of me to think so. Majiir woke up and immediately fixed the server, which we're moving back to later. We still keep regular backups and both Majiir and I are in a position to take emergency measures to fix downtime. In this case, I spun up a temporary replacement server and restored a backup to it. The important thing to note that in the case of catastrophic failure (like the server disappearing from the face of the Earth), I was able to completely restore the site within 3 hours of finding out. Majiir is able to do the same.

Regarding ads, Kerbal Stuff doesn't need money. I know of at least one mod that has decided to host on Curse instead of Kerbal Stuff because Curse gives them a cut of ad revenue. I brought it up for discussion on the forums to see if that was worth doing for KS, too. KS itself doesn't need money, the idea was to give 100% of the revenue directly to the modders. After discussing it, though, we all agreed that it's not a great idea, so we're not doing it.

tl;dr site's up, everything's fine, ads aren't happening.
Brings to mind an old saying about how the best way to ruin a friendship is to buy a boat together. I guess in the 21st century that applies to running a server together as well.
